noun.description: A silky case spun by the larvae of many insects for protection in the pupal stage.

verb.description: Envelop or surround in a protective or comforting way.
examples: we began to feel cold even though we were cocooned in our sleeping bags

origin: Late 17th century: from French cocon, from medieval Provençal coucoun eggshell, cocoon, diminutive of coca shell. The verb dates from the mid 19th century.
